title: I feel like there is almost no counterplay to Ornn in lane, if your playing a melee.
body: The most frustrating thing is how the brittle mark lasts entire 6s duration. If he buys slightest bit of cdr, you basically have no windows to ever trade with him, because by the time brittle mark wears off, his w is up again.  I really don't think the mark should last that long...

replies.body:
I'm basically repeating what i always say but:

Riot didn't identify what was wrong with him after his release

Overview of Ornn on release:

Good/Decent laning phase -------------------> extremely hard to do anything outside of laning phase 

Riot not only buffed something he needed to keep him in line during the laning phase (mana costs), but they also buffed his ult, and w. 

So now you have a champion that crowds out a lot of the other options in top lane. Because he doesn't have a clear weakpoint in the game anymore.

Revert his mana cost buffs, see how Ornn players do without being able to spam rotations and go from there.

I would prefer his cooldowns were increased rather than mana costs lowered. Not needing to back to buy items is pretty useless if you are forced to back for mana constantly.

If ornn uses an ability or even 2 it gives no window to move against him because everything he has a cast time anyway and his cooldowns are so low.

That's the whole point why he initially had higher mana costs. He is a tank with the ability to buy items in lane. There was a need to give him _some_ reason to leave the lane occasionally and not just sitting at top lane til minute 20.

As a juggernaut he should be extremely difficult to fight head on, especially as a melee character. Personally I think he's fine as he is, except that his W carries a little too much power. It makes him cc immune, shields him, deals damage and applies brittle. Even though he can't change direction, and he's really dependant on landing the brittle effect, it still carries too much power.

His Brittle empowered auto was always there and was never a problem before. His power jumped after the buff to the % damage from the actual fire breath. 

Even now, at level 9, you still have over half health from one trade. It takes time for him to really kill you.

You can however still avoid taking the full damage by getting out of the breath, as it’s spread over the 5 ticks (max rank is 4% per tick).

Best option right now? Freeze lane near your tower. His W is also his best waveclear and if he’s hitting the minions as well, it’ll push to your tower. Close enough and when he tries to harass and farm he can take shots from the tower.
